title: The Secret Scout For The Daily Mail
text: This Manchester lad who served his apprenticeship with Liverpool really caught my eye. Playing as one of a midfield three, he drifted between defence and attack, clearly the fulcrum of the Oxford side. He has great energy and links the play, moving across the width of the field to get on the ball and make positive passes. He 'pings' the ball beautifully with his right foot and is given the responsibility for all corners, which he drives in with pace and accuracy. Some players were slow to read his passes but one perfectly paced ball bisected the right back and centre back to put his own left back in a crossing position. ...read
description: The Secret Scout For The Daily Mail Columnist Archive for MailOnline
